Class com.heaton.bot.BotExclusion

Class com.heaton.bot.BotExclusion 

Object
   |
   +----com.heaton.bot.BotExclusion
public class BotExclusion
extends Object
The bot exclusion class is used to read and process a robots.txt file from a web site. Using this file a bot can make sure it is obeying this public policy file.

Version:
1.0
Author:
Jeff Heaton

_exclude
A list of full URL's to exclude.
_robotFile
The full URL of the robots.txt file.

com.heaton.bot.BotExclusion()

getExclude()
Returns a list of URL's to be excluded.
getRobotFile()
Returns the full URL of the robots.txt file.
isExcluded(String)
This is the main worker method for this class.
load(HTTP, String)

_exclude 
protected java.util.Vector _exclude
A list of full URL's to exclude.

_robotFile 
protected java.lang.String _robotFile
The full URL of the robots.txt file.

BotExclusion 
public BotExclusion()

getExclude 
public java.util.Vector getExclude()
Returns a list of URL's to be excluded.

Returns:
A vector of URL's to be excluded.
getRobotFile 
public java.lang.String getRobotFile()
Returns the full URL of the robots.txt file.

Returns:
The full URL of the robots.txt file.
isExcluded 
public boolean isExcluded(String url)
This is the main worker method for this class. This method can be called to determine if the specified URL should be excluded.

Parameters:
url - The URL to be checked.
Returns:
Returns true if the specified URL is to be excluded. Returns false if not.
load 
public void load(HTTP http,
                 String url) throws MalformedURLException, UnknownHostException, IOException

Parameters:
http - A HTTP object to use.
url - A URL from the webster to load the robots.txt file from.
